table.name: attribute_definition
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION table contains records defining Attributes, or covariates, to members of a Cohort through an associated description and syntax and upon instantiation (execution of the algorithm) placed into the COHORT_ATTRIBUTE table. Attributes are derived elements that can be selected or calculated for a subject in a Cohort. The ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION table provides a standardized structure for maintaining the rules governing the calculation of covariates for a subject in a Cohort, and can store operational programming code to instantiate the Attributes for a given Cohort within the OMOP Common Data Model.

column.name: attribute_definition_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Attribute.

column.name: attribute_name
column.remarks: A short description of the Attribute.

column.name: attribute_description
column.remarks: A complete description of the Attribute definition

column.name: attribute_type_concept_id
column.remarks: Type defining what kind of Attribute Definition the record represents and how the syntax may be executed

column.name: attribute_syntax
column.remarks: Syntax or code to operationalize the Attribute definition

table.name: care_site
table.remarks: [SYSTEM] The CARE_SITE table contains a list of uniquely identified institutional (physical or organizational) units where healthcare delivery is practiced (offices, wards, hospitals, clinics, etc.).

column.name: care_site_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Care Site.

column.name: care_site_name
column.remarks: The verbatim description or name of the Care Site as in data source

column.name: place_of_service_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Place of Service Concept ID in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the geographic Location in the LOCATION table, where the detailed address information is stored.

column.name: care_site_source_value
column.remarks: The identifier for the Care Site in the source data, stored here for reference.

column.name: place_of_service_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Place of Service as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

table.name: cdm_source
table.remarks: [METADATA] The CDM_SOURCE table contains detail about the source database and the process used to transform the data into the OMOP Common Data Model.

column.name: cdm_source_name
column.remarks: The full name of the source

column.name: cdm_source_abbreviation
column.remarks: An abbreviation of the name

column.name: cdm_holder
column.remarks: The name of the organization responsible for the development of the CDM instance

column.name: source_description
column.remarks: A description of the source data origin and purpose for collection. The description may contain a summary of the period of time that is expected to be covered by this dataset.

column.name: source_documentation_reference
column.remarks: URL or other external reference to location of source documentation

column.name: cdm_etl_reference
column.remarks: URL or other external reference to location of ETL specification documentation and ETL source code

column.name: source_release_date
column.remarks: The date for which the source data are most current, such as the last day of data capture

column.name: cdm_release_date
column.remarks: The date when the CDM was instantiated

column.name: cdm_version
column.remarks: The version of CDM used

column.name: vocabulary_version
column.remarks: The version of the vocabulary used

table.name: cohort
table.remarks: [DERIVED] The COHORT table contains records of subjects that satisfy a given set of criteria for a duration of time. The definition of the cohort is contained within the COHORT_DEFINITION table. Cohorts can be constructed of patients (Persons), Providers or Visits.

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a record in the COHORT_DEFINITION table containing relevant Cohort Definition information.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the subject in the cohort. These could be referring to records in the PERSON, PROVIDER, VISIT_OCCURRENCE table.

column.name: cohort_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the Cohort Definition criteria for the Person, Provider or Visit first match.

column.name: cohort_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the Cohort Definition criteria for the Person, Provider or Visit no longer match or the Cohort membership was terminated.

table.name: cohort_attribute
table.remarks: [DERIVED] The COHORT_ATTRIBUTE table contains attributes associated with each subject within a cohort, as defined by a given set of criteria for a duration of time. The definition of the Cohort Attribute is contained in the ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION table.

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a record in the [COHORT_DEFINITION](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/COHORT_DEFINITION) table containing relevant Cohort Definition information.

column.name: cohort_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the Cohort Definition criteria for the Person, Provider or Visit first match.

column.name: cohort_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the Cohort Definition criteria for the Person, Provider or Visit no longer match or the Cohort membership was terminated.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the subject in the Cohort. These could be referring to records in the PERSON, PROVIDER, VISIT_OCCURRENCE table.

column.name: attribute_definition_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a record in the [ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION) table containing relevant Attribute Definition information.

column.name: value_as_number
column.remarks: The attribute result stored as a number. This is applicable to attributes where the result is expressed as a numeric value.

column.name: value_as_concept_id
column.remarks: The attribute result stored as a Concept ID. This is applicable to attributes where the result is expressed as a categorical value.

table.name: cohort_definition
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The COHORT_DEFINITION table contains records defining a Cohort derived from the data through the associated description and syntax and upon instantiation (execution of the algorithm) placed into the COHORT table. Cohorts are a set of subjects that satisfy a given combination of inclusion criteria for a duration of time. The COHORT_DEFINITION table provides a standardized structure for maintaining the rules governing the inclusion of a subject into a cohort, and can store operational programming code to instantiate the cohort within the OMOP Common Data Model.

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Cohort.

column.name: cohort_definition_name
column.remarks: A short description of the Cohort.

column.name: cohort_definition_description
column.remarks: A complete description of the Cohort definition

column.name: definition_type_concept_id
column.remarks: Type defining what kind of Cohort Definition the record represents and how the syntax may be executed

column.name: cohort_definition_syntax
column.remarks: Syntax or code to operationalize the Cohort definition

column.name: subject_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept to which defines the domain of subjects that are members of the cohort (e.g., Person, Provider, Visit).

column.name: cohort_initiation_date
column.remarks: A date to indicate when the Cohort was initiated in the COHORT table

table.name: concept
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The Standardized Vocabularies contains records, or Concepts, that uniquely identify each fundamental unit of meaning used to express clinical information in all domain tables of the CDM. Concepts are derived from vocabularies, which represent clinical information across a domain (e.g. conditions, drugs, procedures) through the use of codes and associated descriptions. Some Concepts are designated Standard Concepts, meaning these Concepts can be used as normative expressions of a clinical entity within the OMOP Common Data Model and within standardized analytics. Each Standard Concept belongs to one domain, which defines the location where the Concept would be expected to occur within data tables of the CDM.

column.name: concept_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Concept across all domains.

column.name: concept_name
column.remarks: An unambiguous, meaningful and descriptive name for the Concept.

column.name: domain_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the [DOMAIN](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/DOMAIN) table the Concept belongs to.

column.name: vocabulary_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the [VOCABULARY](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/VOCABULARY) table indicating from which source the Concept has been adapted.

column.name: concept_class_id
column.remarks: The attribute or concept class of the Concept. Examples are 'Clinical Drug', 'Ingredient', 'Clinical Finding'etc.

column.name: standard_concept
column.remarks: This flag determines where a Concept is a Standard Concept, i.e. is used in the data, a Classification Concept, or a non-standard Source Concept. The allowables values are 'S'(Standard Concept) and 'C'(Classification Concept), otherwise the content is NULL.

column.name: concept_code
column.remarks: The concept code represents the identifier of the Concept in the source vocabulary, such as SNOMED-CT concept IDs, RxNorm RXCUIs etc. Note that concept codes are not unique across vocabularies.

column.name: valid_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the Concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970, meaning, the Concept has no (known) date of inception.

column.name: valid_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the Concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099, meaning, the Concept is valid until it becomes deprecated.

column.name: invalid_reason
column.remarks: Reason the Concept was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

table.name: concept_ancestor
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table is designed to simplify observational analysis by providing the complete hierarchical relationships between Concepts. Only direct parent-child relationships between Concepts are stored in the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table. To determine higher level ancestry connections, all individual direct relationships would have to be navigated at analysis time. The CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table includes records for all parent-child relationships, as well as grandparent-grandchild relationships and those of any other level of lineage. Using the CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table allows for querying for all descendants of a hierarchical concept. For example, drug ingredients and drug products are all descendants of a drug class ancestor.

column.name: ancestor_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table for the higher-level concept that forms the ancestor in the relationship.

column.name: descendant_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table for the lower-level concept that forms the descendant in the relationship.

column.name: min_levels_of_separation
column.remarks: The minimum separation in number of levels of hierarchy between ancestor and descendant concepts. This is an attribute that is used to simplify hierarchic analysis.

column.name: max_levels_of_separation
column.remarks: The maximum separation in number of levels of hierarchy between ancestor and descendant concepts. This is an attribute that is used to simplify hierarchic analysis.

table.name: concept_class
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The CONCEPT_CLASS table is a reference table, which includes a list of the classifications used to differentiate Concepts within a given Vocabulary. This reference table is populated with a single record for each Concept Class:

column.name: concept_class_id
column.remarks: A unique key for each class.

column.name: concept_class_name
column.remarks: The name describing the Concept Class, e.g. "Clinical Finding", "Ingredient", etc.

column.name: concept_class_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the [CONCEPT](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONCEPT) table for the unique Concept Class the record belongs to.

table.name: concept_relationship
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table contains records that define direct relationships between any two Concepts and the nature or type of the relationship. Each type of a relationship is defined in the [RELATIONSHIP](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/RELATIONSHIP) table.

column.name: concept_id_1
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept in the [CONCEPT](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONCEPT) table associated with the relationship. Relationships are directional, and this field represents the source concept designation.

column.name: concept_id_2
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept in the [CONCEPT](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONCEPT) table associated with the relationship. Relationships are directional, and this field represents the destination concept designation.

column.name: relationship_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier to the type or nature of the Relationship as defined in the [RELATIONSHIP](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/RELATIONSHIP) table.

column.name: valid_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the instance of the Concept Relationship is first recorded.

column.name: valid_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the Concept Relationship became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new relationship. Default value is 31-Dec-2099.

column.name: invalid_reason
column.remarks: Reason the relationship was invalidated. Possible values are 'D'(deleted), 'U'(replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

table.name: concept_synonym
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The CONCEPT_SYNONYM table is used to store alternate names and descriptions for Concepts.

column.name: concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table.

column.name: concept_synonym_name
column.remarks: The alternative name for the Concept.

column.name: language_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept representing the language.

table.name: condition_era
table.remarks: [DERIVED] A Condition Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to have a given condition.

column.name: condition_era_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Condition Era.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is experiencing the Condition during the Condition Era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: condition_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a standard Condition Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: condition_era_start_date
column.remarks: The start date for the Condition Era constructed from the individual instances of Condition Occurrences. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of the condition.

column.name: condition_era_end_date
column.remarks: The end date for the Condition Era constructed from the individual instances of Condition Occurrences. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of the Condition.

column.name: condition_occurrence_count
column.remarks: The number of individual Condition Occurrences used to construct the condition era.

table.name: condition_occurrence
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] Conditions are records of a Person suggesting the presence of a disease or medical condition stated as a diagnosis, a sign or a symptom, which is either observed by a Provider or reported by the patient. Conditions are recorded in different sources and levels of standardization, for example:

column.name: condition_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Condition Occurrence event.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is experiencing the condition. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: condition_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Condition Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: condition_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the instance of the Condition is recorded.

column.name: condition_start_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time when the instance of the Condition is recorded.

column.name: condition_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.

column.name: condition_end_datetime
column.remarks: The date when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.

column.name: condition_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source data from which the condition was recorded, the level of standardization, and the type of occurrence.

column.name: stop_reason
column.remarks: The reason that the condition was no longer present, as indicated in the source data.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for capturing (diagnosing) the Condition.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table during which the Condition was determined (diagnosed).

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the Condition was determined (diagnosed).

column.name: condition_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the condition as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard condition concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

column.name: condition_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Condition Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: condition_status_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the condition status as it appears in the source data.

column.name: condition_status_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the standard vocabulary reflecting the condition status

table.name: cost
table.remarks: [ECONOMIC] The COST table captures records containing the cost of any medical entity recorded in one of the DRUG_EXPOSURE, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE, VISIT_OCCURRENCE or DEVICE_OCCURRENCE tables. It replaces the corresponding DRUG_COST, PROCEDURE_COST, VISIT_COST or DEVICE_COST tables that were initially defined for the OMOP CDM V5. However, it also allows to capture cost information for records of the OBSERVATION and MEASUREMENT tables.

column.name: cost_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each COST record.

column.name: cost_event_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the event (e.g. Measurement, Procedure, Visit, Drug Exposure, etc) record for which cost data are recorded.

column.name: cost_domain_id
column.remarks: The concept representing the domain of the cost event, from which the corresponding table can be inferred that contains the entity for which cost information is recorded.

column.name: cost_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to a concept in the CONCEPT table for the provenance or the source of the COST data: Calculated from insurance claim information, provider revenue, calculated from cost-to-charge ratio, reported from accounting database, etc.

column.name: currency_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the concept representing the 3-letter code used to delineate international currencies, such as USD for US Dollar.

column.name: total_charge
column.remarks: The total amount charged by some provider of goods or services (e.g. hospital, physician pharmacy, dme provider) to payers (insurance companies, the patient).

column.name: total_cost
column.remarks: The cost incurred by the provider of goods or services.

column.name: total_paid
column.remarks: The total amount actually paid from all payers for goods or services of the provider.

column.name: paid_by_payer
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Payer for the goods or services.

column.name: paid_by_patient
column.remarks: The total amount paid by the Person as a share of the expenses.

column.name: paid_patient_copay
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Person as a fixed contribution to the expenses.

column.name: paid_patient_coinsurance
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Person as a joint assumption of risk. Typically, this is a percentage of the expenses defined by the Payer Plan after the Person's deductible is exceeded.

column.name: paid_patient_deductible
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Person that is counted toward the deductible defined by the Payer Plan. paid_patient_deductible does contribute to the paid_by_patient variable.

column.name: paid_by_primary
column.remarks: The amount paid by a primary Payer through the coordination of benefits.

column.name: paid_ingredient_cost
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Payer to a pharmacy for the drug, excluding the amount paid for dispensing the drug. paid_ingredient_cost contributes to the paid_by_payer field if this field is populated with a nonzero value.

column.name: paid_dispensing_fee
column.remarks: The amount paid by the Payer to a pharmacy for dispensing a drug, excluding the amount paid for the drug ingredient. paid_dispensing_fee contributes to the paid_by_payer field if this field is populated with a nonzero value.

column.name: payer_plan_period_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the PAYER_PLAN_PERIOD table, where the details of the Payer, Plan and Family are stored. Record the payer_plan_id that relates to the payer who contributed to the paid_by_payer field.

column.name: amount_allowed
column.remarks: The contracted amount agreed between the payer and provider.

column.name: revenue_code_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key referring to a Standard Concept ID in the Standardized Vocabularies for Revenue codes.

column.name: revenue_code_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Revenue code as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

column.name: drg_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the DRG Vocabulary reflecting the DRG for a visit.

column.name: drg_source_value
column.remarks: The 3-digit DRG source code as it appears in the source data.

table.name: death
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The death domain contains the clinical event for how and when a Person dies. A person can have up to one record if the source system contains evidence about the Death, such as:

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the deceased person. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

column.name: death_date
column.remarks: The date the person was deceased. If the precise date including day or month is not known or not allowed, December is used as the default month, and the last day of the month the default day.

column.name: death_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time the person was deceased. If the precise date including day or month is not known or not allowed, December is used as the default month, and the last day of the month the default day.

column.name: death_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key referring to the predefined concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting how the death was represented in the source data.

column.name: cause_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key referring to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for conditions.

column.name: cause_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the cause of death as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: cause_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the concept that refers to the code used in the source. Note, this variable name is abbreviated to ensure it will be allowable across database platforms.

table.name: device_exposure
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The device exposure domain captures information about a person's exposure to a foreign physical object or instrument that which is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes through a mechanism beyond chemical action. Devices include implantable objects (e.g. pacemakers, stents, artificial joints), medical equipment and supplies (e.g. bandages, crutches, syringes), other instruments used in medical procedures (e.g. sutures, defibrillators) and material used in clinical care (e.g. adhesives, body material, dental material, surgical material).

column.name: device_exposure_id
column.remarks: A system-generated unique identifier for each Device Exposure.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Device. The demographic details of that person are stored in the Person table.

column.name: device_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Device concept.

column.name: device_exposure_start_date
column.remarks: The date the Device or supply was applied or used.

column.name: device_exposure_start_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time the Device or supply was applied or used.

column.name: device_exposure_end_date
column.remarks: The date the Device or supply was removed from use.

column.name: device_exposure_end_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time the Device or supply was removed from use.

column.name: device_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Device Exposure recorded. It indicates how the Device Exposure was represented in the source data.

column.name: unique_device_id
column.remarks: A UDI or equivalent identifying the instance of the Device used in the Person.

column.name: quantity
column.remarks: The number of individual Devices used for the exposure.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who initiated of administered the Device.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT table during which the device was used.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the visit-detail table during which the Drug Exposure was initiated.

column.name: device_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Device as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard Device Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

column.name: device_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Device Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

table.name: domain
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The DOMAIN table includes a list of OMOP-defined Domains the Concepts of the Standardized Vocabularies can belong to. A Domain defines the set of allowable Concepts for the standardized fields in the CDM tables. For example, the "Condition" Domain contains Concepts that describe a condition of a patient, and these Concepts can only be stored in the condition_concept_id field of the [CONDITION_OCCURRENCE](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONDITION_OCCURRENCE) and [CONDITION_ERA](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONDITION_ERA) tables. This reference table is populated with a single record for each Domain and includes a descriptive name for the Domain.

column.name: domain_id
column.remarks: A unique key for each domain.

column.name: domain_name
column.remarks: The name describing the Domain, e.g. "Condition", "Procedure", "Measurement" etc.

column.name: domain_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the [CONCEPT](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONCEPT) table for the unique Domain Concept the Domain record belongs to.

table.name: dose_era
table.remarks: [DERIVED] A Dose Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to be exposed to a constant dose of a specific active ingredient.

column.name: dose_era_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Dose Era.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the drug during the drug era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: drug_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the active Ingredient Concept.

column.name: unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the unit concept.

column.name: dose_value
column.remarks: The numeric value of the dose.

column.name: dose_era_start_date
column.remarks: The start date for the drug era constructed from the individual instances of drug exposures. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

column.name: dose_era_end_date
column.remarks: The end date for the drug era constructed from the individual instance of drug exposures. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

table.name: drug_era
table.remarks: [DERIVED] A Drug Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to be exposed to a particular active ingredient. A Drug Era is not the same as a Drug Exposure: Exposures are individual records corresponding to the source when Drug was delivered to the Person, while successive periods of Drug Exposures are combined under certain rules to produce continuous Drug Eras.

column.name: drug_era_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Drug Era.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Drug during the fDrug Era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: drug_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Ingredient Concept.

column.name: drug_era_start_date
column.remarks: The start date for the Drug Era constructed from the individual instances of Drug Exposures. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of conutilization of a Drug.

column.name: drug_era_end_date
column.remarks: The end date for the drug era constructed from the individual instance of drug exposures. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

column.name: drug_exposure_count
column.remarks: The number of individual Drug Exposure occurrences used to construct the Drug Era.

column.name: gap_days
column.remarks: The number of days that are not covered by DRUG_EXPOSURE records that were used to make up the era record.

table.name: drug_exposure
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The drug exposure domain captures records about the utilization of a Drug when ingested or otherwise introduced into the body. A Drug is a biochemical substance formulated in such a way that when administered to a Person it will exert a certain physiological effect. Drugs include prescription and over-the-counter medicines, vaccines, and large-molecule biologic therapies. Radiological devices ingested or applied locally do not count as Drugs.

column.name: drug_exposure_id
column.remarks: A system-generated unique identifier for each Drug utilization event.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the person who is subjected to the Drug. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

column.name: drug_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Drug concept.

column.name: drug_exposure_start_date
column.remarks: The start date for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start date of a prescription, the date a prescription was filled, or the date on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.

column.name: drug_exposure_start_datetime
column.remarks: The start date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start date of a prescription, the date a prescription was filled, or the date on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.

column.name: drug_exposure_end_date
column.remarks: The end date for the current instance of Drug utilization. It is not available from all sources.

column.name: drug_exposure_end_datetime
column.remarks: The end date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. It is not available from all sources.

column.name: verbatim_end_date
column.remarks: The known end date of a drug_exposure as provided by the source

column.name: drug_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Drug Exposure recorded. It indicates how the Drug Exposure was represented in the source data.

column.name: stop_reason
column.remarks: The reason the Drug was stopped. Reasons include regimen completed, changed, removed, etc.

column.name: refills
column.remarks: The number of refills after the initial prescription. The initial prescription is not counted, values start with 0.

column.name: quantity
column.remarks: The quantity of drug as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record.

column.name: days_supply
column.remarks: The number of days of supply of the medication as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record.

column.name: sig
column.remarks: The directions ("signetur") on the Drug prescription as recorded in the original prescription (and printed on the container) or dispensing record.

column.name: route_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a predefined concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the route of administration.

column.name: lot_number
column.remarks: An identifier assigned to a particular quantity or lot of Drug product from the manufacturer.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who initiated (prescribed or administered) the Drug Exposure.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the Drug Exposure was initiated.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the Drug Exposure was initiated.

column.name: drug_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Drug as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Drug concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: drug_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Drug Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: route_source_value
column.remarks: The information about the route of administration as detailed in the source.

column.name: dose_unit_source_value
column.remarks: The information about the dose unit as detailed in the source.

table.name: drug_strength
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The DRUG_STRENGTH table contains structured content about the amount or concentration and associated units of a specific ingredient contained within a particular drug product. This table is supplemental information to support standardized analysis of drug utilization.

column.name: drug_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for Branded Drug or Clinical Drug Concept.

column.name: ingredient_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table, representing the identifier for drug Ingredient Concept contained within the drug product.

column.name: amount_value
column.remarks: The numeric value associated with the amount of active ingredient contained within the product.

column.name: amount_unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the Unit for the absolute amount of active ingredient.

column.name: numerator_value
column.remarks: The numeric value associated with the concentration of the active ingredient contained in the product

column.name: numerator_unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the numerator Unit for the concentration of active ingredient.

column.name: denominator_value
column.remarks: The amount of total liquid (or other divisible product, such as ointment, gel, spray, etc.).

column.name: denominator_unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the denominator Unit for the concentration of active ingredient.

column.name: box_size
column.remarks: The number of units of Clinical of Branded Drug, or Quantified Clinical or Branded Drug contained in a box as dispensed to the patient

column.name: valid_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the Concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970.

column.name: valid_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new Concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099.

column.name: invalid_reason
column.remarks: Reason the concept was invalidated. Possible values are 'D'(deleted), 'U'(replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

table.name: fact_relationship
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The FACT_RELATIONSHIP table contains records about the relationships between facts stored as records in any table of the CDM. Relationships can be defined between facts from the same domain (table), or different domains. Examples of Fact Relationships include: Person relationships (parent-child), care site relationships (hierarchical organizational structure of facilities within a health system), indication relationship (between drug exposures and associated conditions), usage relationships (of devices during the course of an associated procedure), or facts derived from one another (measurements derived from an associated specimen).

column.name: domain_concept_id_1
column.remarks: The concept representing the domain of fact one, from which the corresponding table can be inferred.

column.name: fact_id_1
column.remarks: The unique identifier in the table corresponding to the domain of fact one.

column.name: domain_concept_id_2
column.remarks: The concept representing the domain of fact two, from which the corresponding table can be inferred.

column.name: fact_id_2
column.remarks: The unique identifier in the table corresponding to the domain of fact two.

column.name: relationship_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept ID of relationship in the Standardized Vocabularies.

table.name: location
table.remarks: [SYSTEM] The LOCATION table represents a generic way to capture physical location or address information of Persons and Care Sites.

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each geographic location.

column.name: address_1
column.remarks: The address field 1, typically used for the street address, as it appears in the source data.

column.name: address_2
column.remarks: The address field 2, typically used for additional detail such as buildings, suites, floors, as it appears in the source data.

column.name: city
column.remarks: The city field as it appears in the source data.

column.name: state
column.remarks: The state field as it appears in the source data.

column.name: zip
column.remarks: The zip or postal code.

column.name: county
column.remarks: The county.

column.name: location_source_value
column.remarks: The verbatim information that is used to uniquely identify the location as it appears in the source data.

table.name: measurement
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The MEASUREMENT table contains records of Measurement, i.e. structured values (numerical or categorical) obtained through systematic and standardized examination or testing of a Person or Person's sample. The MEASUREMENT table contains both orders and results of such Measurements as laboratory tests, vital signs, quantitative findings from pathology reports, etc.

column.name: measurement_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Measurement.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the measurement was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: measurement_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the standard measurement concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: measurement_date
column.remarks: The date of the Measurement.

column.name: measurement_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the Measurement. Some database systems don't have a datatype of time. To accomodate all temporal analyses, datatype datetime can be used (combining measurement_date and measurement_time [forum discussion](http://forums.ohdsi.org/t/date-time-and-datetime-problem-and-the-world-of-hours-and-1day/314))

column.name: measurement_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the provenance from where the Measurement record was recorded.

column.name: operator_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the mathematical operator that is applied to the value_as_number. Operators are <, <=, =, >=, >.

column.name: value_as_number
column.remarks: A Measurement result where the result is expressed as a numeric value.

column.name: value_as_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Measurement result represented as a Concept from the Standardized Vocabularies (e.g., positive/negative, present/absent, low/high, etc.).

column.name: unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept ID of Measurement Units in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: range_low
column.remarks: The lower limit of the normal range of the Measurement result. The lower range is assumed to be of the same unit of measure as the Measurement value.

column.name: range_high
column.remarks: The upper limit of the normal range of the Measurement. The upper range is assumed to be of the same unit of measure as the Measurement value.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for initiating or obtaining the measurement.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table during which the Measurement was recorded.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the Measurement was recorded.

column.name: measurement_source_value
column.remarks: The Measurement name as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

column.name: measurement_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept in the Standard Vocabularies that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: unit_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

column.name: value_source_value
column.remarks: The source value associated with the content of the value_as_number or value_as_concept_id as stored in the source data.

table.name: note
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The NOTE table captures unstructured information that was recorded by a provider about a patient in free text notes on a given date.

column.name: note_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each note.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the Note was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: note_date
column.remarks: The date the note was recorded.

column.name: note_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time the note was recorded.

column.name: note_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type, origin or provenance of the Note.

column.name: note_class_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the HL7 LOINC Document Type Vocabulary classification of the note.

column.name: note_title
column.remarks: The title of the Note as it appears in the source.

column.name: note_text
column.remarks: The content of the Note.

column.name: encoding_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the note character encoding type

column.name: language_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the language of the note

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Provider in the PROVIDER table who took the Note.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: Foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table when the Note was taken.

column.name: note_source_value
column.remarks: The source value associated with the origin of the note

table.name: note_nlp
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The NOTE_NLP table will encode all output of NLP on clinical notes. Each row represents a single extracted term from a note.

column.name: note_nlp_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each term extracted from a note.

column.name: note_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Note table note the term was extracted from.

column.name: section_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies representing the section of the extracted term.

column.name: snippet
column.remarks: A small window of text surrounding the term.

column.name: offset
column.remarks: Character offset of the extracted term in the input note.

column.name: lexical_variant
column.remarks: Raw text extracted from the NLP tool.

column.name: note_nlp_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the normalized concept for the extracted term. Domain of the term is represented as part of the Concept table.

column.name: note_nlp_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code in the source vocabulary used by the NLP system

column.name: nlp_system
column.remarks: Name and version of the NLP system that extracted the term.Useful for data provenance.

column.name: nlp_date
column.remarks: The date of the note processing.Useful for data provenance.

column.name: nlp_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the note processing. Useful for data provenance.

column.name: term_exists
column.remarks: A summary modifier that signifies presence or absence of the term for a given patient. Useful for quick querying. *

table.name: observation
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The OBSERVATION table captures clinical facts about a Person obtained in the context of examination, questioning or a procedure. Any data that cannot be represented by any other domains, such as social and lifestyle facts, medical history, family history, etc. are recorded here.

column.name: observation_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each observation.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the observation was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: observation_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the standard observation concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: observation_date
column.remarks: The date of the observation.

column.name: observation_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the observation.

column.name: observation_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of the observation.

column.name: value_as_number
column.remarks: The observation result stored as a number. This is applicable to observations where the result is expressed as a numeric value.

column.name: value_as_string
column.remarks: The observation result stored as a string. This is applicable to observations where the result is expressed as verbatim text.

column.name: value_as_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to an observation result stored as a Concept ID. This is applicable to observations where the result can be expressed as a Standard Concept from the Standardized Vocabularies (e.g., positive/negative, present/absent, low/high, etc.).

column.name: qualifier_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept ID for a qualifier (e.g., severity of drug-drug interaction alert)

column.name: unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept ID of measurement units in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for making the observation.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table during which the observation was recorded.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the observation was recorded.

column.name: observation_source_value
column.remarks: The observation code as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: observation_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: unit_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: qualifier_source_value
column.remarks: The source value associated with a qualifier to characterize the observation

table.name: observation_period
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The OBSERVATION_PERIOD table contains records which uniquely define the spans of time for which a Person is at-risk to have clinical events recorded within the source systems, even if no events in fact are recorded (healthy patient with no healthcare interactions).

column.name: observation_period_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each observation period.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the person for whom the observation period is defined. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

column.name: observation_period_start_date
column.remarks: The start date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source.

column.name: observation_period_end_date
column.remarks: The end date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source.

column.name: period_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the predefined concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source of the observation period information

table.name: payer_plan_period
table.remarks: [ECONOMIC] The PAYER_PLAN_PERIOD table captures details of the period of time that a Person is continuously enrolled under a specific health Plan benefit structure from a given Payer. Each Person receiving healthcare is typically covered by a health benefit plan, which pays for (fully or partially), or directly provides, the care. These benefit plans are provided by payers, such as health insurances or state or government agencies. In each plan the details of the health benefits are defined for the Person or her family, and the health benefit Plan might change over time typically with increasing utilization (reaching certain cost thresholds such as deductibles), plan availability and purchasing choices of the Person. The unique combinations of Payer organizations, health benefit Plans and time periods in which they are valid for a Person are recorded in this table.

column.name: payer_plan_period_id
column.remarks: A identifier for each unique combination of payer, plan, family code and time span.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person covered by the payer. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: payer_plan_period_start_date
column.remarks: The start date of the payer plan period.

column.name: payer_plan_period_end_date
column.remarks: The end date of the payer plan period.

column.name: payer_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the payer as it appears in the source data.

column.name: plan_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Person's health benefit plan as it appears in the source data.

column.name: family_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Person's family as it appears in the source data.

table.name: person
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The Person Domain contains records that uniquely identify each patient in the source data who is time at-risk to have clinical observations recorded within the source systems.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each person.

column.name: gender_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.

column.name: year_of_birth
column.remarks: The year of birth of the person. For data sources with date of birth, the year is extracted. For data sources where the year of birth is not available, the approximate year of birth is derived based on any age group categorization available.

column.name: month_of_birth
column.remarks: The month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the month is extracted and stored in this field.

column.name: day_of_birth
column.remarks: The day of the month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the day is extracted and stored in this field.

column.name: birth_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of birth of the person.

column.name: race_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique race of the person.

column.name: ethnicity_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the ethnicity of the person.

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the place of residency for the person in the location table, where the detailed address information is stored.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the primary care provider the person is seeing in the provider table.

column.name: care_site_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the site of primary care in the care_site table, where the details of the care site are stored.

column.name: person_source_value
column.remarks: An (encrypted) key derived from the person identifier in the source data. This is necessary when a use case requires a link back to the person data at the source dataset.

column.name: gender_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the gender of the person as it appears in the source data. The persons gender is mapped to a standard gender concept in the Standardized Vocabularies; the original value is stored here for reference.

column.name: gender_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the gender concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: race_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the race of the person as it appears in the source data. The person race is mapped to a standard race concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original value is stored here for reference.

column.name: race_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the race concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: ethnicity_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the ethnicity of the person as it appears in the source data. The person ethnicity is mapped to a standard ethnicity concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: ethnicity_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the ethnicity concept that refers to the code used in the source.

table.name: procedure_occurrence
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE table contains records of activities or processes ordered by, or carried out by, a healthcare provider on the patient to have a diagnostic or therapeutic purpose. Procedures are present in various data sources in different forms with varying levels of standardization. For example:

column.name: procedure_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A system-generated unique identifier for each Procedure Occurrence.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Procedure. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: procedure_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a standard procedure Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: procedure_date
column.remarks: The date on which the Procedure was performed.

column.name: procedure_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time on which the Procedure was performed.

column.name: procedure_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of source data from which the procedure record is derived.

column.name: modifier_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for a modifier to the Procedure (e.g. bilateral)

column.name: quantity
column.remarks: The quantity of procedures ordered or administered.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was responsible for carrying out the procedure.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the Procedure was carried out.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the Procedure was carried out.

column.name: procedure_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Procedure as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard procedure Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference. Procedure source codes are typically ICD-9-Proc, CPT-4, HCPCS or OPCS-4 codes.

column.name: procedure_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Procedure Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: qualifier_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the qualifier as it appears in the source data.

table.name: provider
table.remarks: [SYSTEM] The PROVIDER table contains a list of uniquely identified healthcare providers. These are individuals providing hands-on healthcare to patients, such as physicians, nurses, midwives, physical therapists etc.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Provider.

column.name: provider_name
column.remarks: A description of the Provider.

column.name: npi
column.remarks: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the provider.

column.name: dea
column.remarks: The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) number of the provider.

column.name: specialty_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Specialty Concept ID in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: care_site_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the main Care Site where the provider is practicing.

column.name: year_of_birth
column.remarks: The year of birth of the Provider.

column.name: gender_concept_id
column.remarks: The gender of the Provider.

column.name: provider_source_value
column.remarks: The identifier used for the Provider in the source data, stored here for reference.

column.name: specialty_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the Provider specialty as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

column.name: specialty_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: gender_source_value
column.remarks: The gender code for the Provider as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

column.name: gender_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

table.name: relationship
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The RELATIONSHIP table provides a reference list of all types of relationships that can be used to associate any two concepts in the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHP table.

column.name: relationship_id
column.remarks: The type of relationship captured by the relationship record.

column.name: relationship_name
column.remarks: The text that describes the relationship type.

column.name: is_hierarchical
column.remarks: Defines whether a relationship defines concepts into classes or hierarchies. Values are 1 for hierarchical relationship or 0 if not.

column.name: defines_ancestry
column.remarks: Defines whether a hierarchical relationship contributes to the concept_ancestor table. These are subsets of the hierarchical relationships. Valid values are 1 or 0.

column.name: reverse_relationship_id
column.remarks: The identifier for the relationship used to define the reverse relationship between two concepts.

column.name: relationship_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique relationship concept.

table.name: source_to_concept_map
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The source to concept map table is a legacy data structure within the OMOP Common Data Model, recommended for use in ETL processes to maintain local source codes which are not available as Concepts in the Standardized Vocabularies, and to establish mappings for each source code into a Standard Concept as target_concept_ids that can be used to populate the Common Data Model tables. The SOURCE_TO_CONCEPT_MAP table is no longer populated with content within the Standardized Vocabularies published to the OMOP community.

column.name: source_code
column.remarks: The source code being translated into a Standard Concept.

column.name: source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the Source Concept that is being translated into a Standard Concept.

column.name: source_vocabulary_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the VOCABULARY table defining the vocabulary of the source code that is being translated to a Standard Concept.

column.name: source_code_description
column.remarks: An optional description for the source code. This is included as a convenience to compare the description of the source code to the name of the concept.

column.name: target_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the target Concept to which the source code is being mapped.

column.name: target_vocabulary_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the VOCABULARY table defining the vocabulary of the target Concept.

column.name: valid_start_date
column.remarks: The date when the mapping instance was first recorded.

column.name: valid_end_date
column.remarks: The date when the mapping instance became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new relationship. Default value is 31-Dec-2099.

column.name: invalid_reason
column.remarks: Reason the mapping instance was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

table.name: specimen
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The specimen domain contains the records identifying biological samples from a person.

column.name: specimen_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each specimen.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the Specimen is recorded.

column.name: specimen_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key referring to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Specimen.

column.name: specimen_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key referring to the Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the system of record from which the Specimen was represented in the source data.

column.name: specimen_date
column.remarks: The date the specimen was obtained from the Person.

column.name: specimen_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time on the date when the Specimen was obtained from the person.

column.name: quantity
column.remarks: The amount of specimen collection from the person during the sampling procedure.

column.name: unit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for the Unit associated with the numeric quantity of the Specimen collection.

column.name: anatomic_site_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for the anatomic location of specimen collection.

column.name: disease_status_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for the Disease Status of specimen collection.

column.name: specimen_source_id
column.remarks: The Specimen identifier as it appears in the source data.

column.name: specimen_source_value
column.remarks: The Specimen value as it appears in the source data. This value is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

column.name: unit_source_value
column.remarks: The information about the Unit as detailed in the source.

column.name: anatomic_site_source_value
column.remarks: The information about the anatomic site as detailed in the source.

column.name: disease_status_source_value
column.remarks: The information about the disease status as detailed in the source.

table.name: visit_detail
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The VISIT_DETAIL table is an optional table used to represents details of each record in the parent visit_occurrence table. For every record in visit_occurrence table there may be 0 or more records in the visit_detail table with a 1:n relationship where n may be 0. The visit_detail table is structurally very similar to visit_occurrence table and belongs to the similar domain as the visit.

column.name: visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Person's visit or encounter at a healthcare provider.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: visit_detail_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a visit Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: visit_start_date
column.remarks: The start date of the visit.

column.name: visit_start_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the visit started.

column.name: visit_end_date
column.remarks: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date.

column.name: visit_end_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the visit end.

column.name: visit_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of source data from which the visit record is derived.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit.

column.name: care_site_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.

column.name: visit_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the visit as it appears in the source data.

column.name: visit_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: admitting_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the admitting source for a visit.

column.name: admitting_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the admitting source as it appears in the source data.

column.name: discharge_to_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the discharge disposition for a visit.

column.name: discharge_to_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.

column.name: preceding_visit_detail_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the VISIT_DETAIL table of the visit immediately preceding this visit

column.name: visit_detail_parent_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the VISIT_DETAIL table record to represent the immediate parent visit-detail record.

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to the record in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table. This is a required field, because for every visit_detail is a child of visit_occurrence and cannot exist without a corresponding parent record in visit_occurrence.

table.name: visit_occurrence
table.remarks: [CLINICAL] The VISIT_OCCURRENCE table contains the spans of time a Person continuously receives medical services from one or more providers at a Care Site in a given setting within the health care system. Visits are classified into 4 settings: outpatient care, inpatient confinement, emergency room, and long-term care. Persons may transition between these settings over the course of an episode of care (for example, treatment of a disease onset).

column.name: visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Person's visit or encounter at a healthcare provider.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

column.name: visit_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a visit Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

column.name: visit_start_date
column.remarks: The start date of the visit.

column.name: visit_start_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the visit started.

column.name: visit_end_date
column.remarks: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date.

column.name: visit_end_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time of the visit end.

column.name: visit_type_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of source data from which the visit record is derived.

column.name: provider_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit.

column.name: care_site_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.

column.name: visit_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the visit as it appears in the source data.

column.name: visit_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

column.name: admitting_source_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the admitting source for a visit.

column.name: admitting_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the admitting source as it appears in the source data.

column.name: discharge_to_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the discharge disposition for a visit.

column.name: discharge_to_source_value
column.remarks: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.

column.name: preceding_visit_occurrence_id
column.remarks: A foreign key to the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table of the visit immediately preceding this visit

table.name: vocabulary
table.remarks: [VOCABULARY] The VOCABULARY table includes a list of the Vocabularies collected from various sources or created de novo by the OMOP community. This reference table is populated with a single record for each Vocabulary source and includes a descriptive name and other associated attributes for the Vocabulary.

column.name: vocabulary_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Vocabulary, such as ICD9CM, SNOMED, Visit.

column.name: vocabulary_name
column.remarks: The name describing the vocabulary, for example "International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification, Volume 1 and 2 (NCHS)" etc.

column.name: vocabulary_reference
column.remarks: External reference to documentation or available download of the about the vocabulary.

column.name: vocabulary_version
column.remarks: Version of the Vocabulary as indicated in the source.

column.name: vocabulary_concept_id
column.remarks: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the CONCEPT table for the Vocabulary the VOCABULARY record belongs to.
